title: Outstaffer Tackling Tech Talent Shortage in APAC
author: Business Wire
excerpt: MELBOURNE, Australia, May 27, 2024--As Australia aims to reach 1.2 million tech workers by 2030, significant challenges remain. Despite recent migration reforms, the Tech Council of Australia reports…
summary:
MELBOURNE, Australia, May 27, 2024--(BUSINESS WIRE)--As Australia aims to reach 1.2 million tech workers by 2030, significant challenges remain. Despite recent migration reforms, the Tech Council of Australia reports that 160,000 young Australians need training to enter the tech workforce.
"While Australia punches above its weight in founding local tech companies that are globally successful, only 1% of Australia's tech workforce has scale-up experience, compared to 17% in Singapore," states TCA CEO, Kate Pounder.
The global tech skills shortage, intensified by the pandemic and rapid digital transformation, has heightened the need for innovative hiring strategies. Border closures further restricted access to overseas talent, increasing the urgency for effective solutions.
Outstaffer, a leading full-service global EOR, announces its upcoming virtual webinar, "Hiring Great Tech Talent in APAC," which will address the tech talent shortage in Australia and the APAC region. The event will be held on Thursday, June 20, 2024, from 12:30 PM to 1:30 PM AEST via Zoom.
The webinar will feature insights from industry experts:
Kellie Shaffier, CEO at HR Shop, Dave Kuhn, CTO at Outstaffer and Ronny Haughton, Co-Founder at The Onset
Event Details:
Date and Time : Thursday, June 20, 2024 from 12:30 PM - 1:30 PM (AEST)
Location: Zoom Webinar
Attendees will learn about accessing global tech talent, navigating compliance, integrating remote teams, anticipating future tech roles and skills, and leveraging cultural diversity for innovation.
Registration:
To register, visit the Event Registration Link.
About Outstaffer:
Outstaffer helps businesses overcome tech talent shortages by providing innovative hiring solutions and support for integrating global tech talent. Focused on compliance, diversity, and future-proofing workforce strategies, Outstaffer leads the transformation in tech hiring.

title: Orlando's growing tech employment a way to prosperity, inclusion
excerpt: Orlando's tech workforce consists of workers employed in tech occupations and those working for tech companies.
summary:
Orlando's tech workforce consists of workers employed in tech occupations and those working for tech companies.
As Orlando's economy evolves, growth in tech employment emerges as an area of opportunity.
The latest data highlights the region's emergence as a tech hub and underscores the need to ensure this growth translates into broad-based prosperity for all.
OFFER ENDS SOON
Get Over 50% Off Your Annual Membership
ACCESS AWARD-WINNING INSIGHTS & INTELLIGENCE
Subscribe Now
Orlando tech employment hits 74,000
Tech employment in Orlando reached 74,000 in 2023 — 2,000 more than in 2022 and 9,500 more than five years ago. Tech employment in the region expanded by 15% between 2018-2023, growing at a faster rate than total employment in the region, and is projected to surpass 76,000 in 2024.
CompTIA's annual State of the Tech Workforce this year highlights Orlando as one of the fastest-growing regions for tech employment in the country.
Florida's fastest-growing tech center
Orlando's tech workforce consists of workers employed in tech occupations and those working for tech companies.
In 2023, the number of people working for tech companies in Orlando (46,896) marginally exceeded the number working in tech occupations (45,641). Software was the dominant activity, with more than half (51.4%) of employees in Orlando's tech industry and the largest share of workers in tech occupations (35.6%).
Orlando's tech employment grew by 2.8% in 2023, the second-highest rate among the 30 most populous regions in the country after Dallas. Orlando's growth was higher than tech favorite Austin (2.4%), Florida peers Miami (2.3%) and Tampa (1.5%), and more than twice the national rate of 1.2%.
Unrealized opportunity
The latest data (2022) suggests the median salary for workers in tech occupations in Orlando was more than double the median wage across all occupations in the region.
Meanwhile, Orlando's tech workforce doesn't reflect the region's racial and gender diversity. Just 28% of tech jobs are held by women, and just 16% and 11% are held by Hispanic and Black workers, respectively.
However, when considered alongside tech's wage premium, the disparity represents an opportunity to move the needle on advancing broad-based prosperity. Growing tech employment among groups for whom Orlando's recent growth has proven inequitable must be a regional priority.
A mandate for action — but also progress
Regions always can do more to grow and nurture tech employment. In Orlando, where growth in tech occupations can be expected to occur organically alongside the region's expanding business base and ongoing technology adoption, the immediate opportunity is to grow and scale tech firms.
The foundation for progress in this area already is being laid. Plug and Play, the world's premier startup accelerator and most-active venture capital investment firm, entered the Orlando market in 2024 with two locations: one near the University of Central Florida and one at Osceola County's NeoCity. This represents a major step forward in growing Orlando's start-up ecosystem and to Orlando becoming America's next great tech hub.
Neil Hamilton is vice president of market intelligence for the Orlando Economic Partnership, where he manages the organization's research activities. Market Commentaries are a series of analyses produced by the Orlando Economic Partnership's market intelligence team, typically associated with a major data release or cover areas key to advancing the partnership's goal of broad-based prosperity.

title: Tech workers navigate layoffs, wage pressures. A closer look
author: Brad Smith
excerpt: According to data from Layoffs.fyi, more than 20,000 employees were fired from their jobs in the tech sector in April. In addition, according to data from Women Impact Tech, salaries for workers in…
summary:
According to data from Layoffs.fyi, more than 20,000 employees were fired from their jobs in the tech sector in April. In addition, according to data from Women Impact Tech, salaries for workers in tech dropped over 12% in 2023.
Women Impact Tech CEO Paula Bratcher Ratliff joins Wealth! to break down the situation for tech workers, highlighting heightened volatility in tech's segment of the US labor market.
On a more positive note, Ratliff claims: "We're seeing about 20% increase over prior years trajectory in hiring for tech workers, and a lot of that has been powered by AI. There's always been this concern, 'will AI cause us to lose more tech workers?' and we're seeing the opposite effect. AI, and other innovations are driving more tech need for organizations and we're seeing improved hiring, and improved hiring in the human capital space for tech because of AI and the impacts of resumes and resume writing."
For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Wealth!

title: Florida Realtors' Tech Helpline Adds Over 20,000 New Members in the Last 90 Days
author: Florida Realtors
excerpt: /PRNewswire/ -- Tech Helpline, real estate's No. 1 tech support service, reports a growth surge. In the last 90 days, Tech Helpline has added five more Realtor...
summary:
Delivers tech support to five new organizations, now serving over 750,000 Realtors
ORLANDO, Fla., March 20, 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- Tech Helpline, real estate's No. 1 tech support service, reports a growth surge. In the last 90 days, Tech Helpline has added five more Realtor organizations with over 20,000 members, including the Kentucky REALTORS® and the Greater Philadelphia Association of REALTORS®.
In addition to Kentucky REALTORS®' 13,075 members and Greater Philadelphia Association of REALTORS® and its 3,475 members, Tech Helpline brings its leading tech support services to the Greater Greenville Association of REALTORS® with 3,774 members, the Southeast Minnesota REALTORS® with 1,100 members, and the Great Smoky Mountains Association of REALTORS®, with 882 members. All these Realtor organization's members now receive free, unlimited access to Tech Helpline's US-based analysts, providing support in both English and Spanish.
"Realtors need tech support now more than ever as we enter the era of AI – artificial intelligence – with new technology coming to market nearly every day, bringing unique challenges," says Margy Grant, Florida Realtors CEO.
"By providing exceptional, friendly tech support tailored to the real estate industry, we can help agents get the most out of the technology they use, help them protect their tech, assist them when they adopt new tools, and get them back in business when their tech crashes," she added.
Tech Helpline, owned and operated by Florida Realtors, is known for its exceptional service. It's been dubbed "the Genius Bar for real estate" as its tech experts have a combined IT experience of more than 350+ years and support thousands of cases each month.
Tech Helpline support is available by phone, email, or through its mobile app, allowing agents on the go to connect quickly to a tech advisor no matter where they are. The app is available for iPhones and iPads in the Apple App Store and for Android devices via Google Play. From the app, agents and brokers can call a Tech Helpline analyst directly, chat with an analyst, or "open a case" to receive email support from an analyst.
Tech Helpline also provides tech support for Form Simplicity, one of the real estate industry's most popular transaction management programs. Form Simplicity is also owned and operated by Florida Realtors and manages over one million transaction sides annually.
US-based Tech Helpline offers real estate agents bilingual support (English and Spanish), providing an enormous range of software and hardware solutions for tech challenges agents encounter daily. Support includes advanced file and computer recovery services, virus and adware removal from devices, Wi-Fi connection issues, software setup, mobile phone crashes, and more.
"Agents and brokers depend on technology to do their jobs every day," Grant noted. "When their tech fails, they need Tech Helpline's support to get back to business. That's why Tech Helpline year-in and year-out is often the number one member benefit for our clients," she added.
Learn more about Tech Helpline at techhelpline.com.
About Tech Helpline
Tech Helpline began 20 years ago as a service for members of Florida Realtors. Known for its no-nonsense technical advice and warm, friendly customer service, Tech Helpline rapidly grew by offering its service to other REALTOR Associations and organizations, Multiple Listing Services (MLSs), and real estate brokerage firms. Tech Helpline is the real estate industry's No. 1 tech support service, available to nearly half the Realtors in North America – with more than 750,000 members, 17 state associations, and over 70 local associations and organizations in the US and Canada. More information is available online at techhelpline.com.
Florida Realtors® serves as the voice for real estate in Florida and is the largest state Realtor association in the US. It provides programs, services, continuing education, research, and legislative representation to more than 238,000 members in 51 boards/associations.

title: Global Sleep Tech Device Market Trends, Forecast and Competitive Analysis, 2018-2023 and 2024-2030
author: Research
excerpt: Dublin, April 19, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The "Sleep Tech Device Market Report: Trends, Forecast and Competitive Analysis to 2030" report has been added to ResearchAndMarkets.com's offering.The…
summary:
Dublin, April 19, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The "Sleep Tech Device Market Report: Trends, Forecast and Competitive Analysis to 2030" report has been added to ResearchAndMarkets.com's offering.The global sleep tech device market is expected to reach an estimated $37.6 billion by 2030 with a CAGR of 15.7% from 2024 to 2030.The future of the global sleep tech device market looks promising with opportunities in the wearable, monitoring device, smart gadget, and digital tool markets. The major drivers for this market are growing number of individuals suffering from sleep disorders, increasing understanding of the benefits of restorative sleep for general health and wellbeing, as well as, putting more emphasis on enhancing the general infrastructure of the healthcare system and the state of healthcare facilities.Companies in the market compete on the basis of product quality offered. Major players in this market focus on expanding their manufacturing facilities, R&D investments, infrastructural development, and leverage integration opportunities across the value chain. With these strategies sleep tech device companies cater increasing demand, ensure competitive effectiveness, develop innovative products & technologies, reduce production costs, and expand their customer base.
Features of the Global Sleep Tech Device Market
Market Size Estimates: Sleep tech device market size estimation in terms of value ($B).
Trend and Forecast Analysis: Market trends (2018 to 2023) and forecast (2024 to 2030) by various segments and regions.
Segmentation Analysis: Sleep tech device market size by distribution channel, product type, and region in terms of value ($B).
Regional Analysis: Sleep tech device market breakdown by North America, Europe, Asia Pacific, and Rest of the World.
Growth Opportunities: Analysis of growth opportunities in different distribution channel, product type, and regions for the sleep tech device market.
Strategic Analysis: This includes M&A, new product development, and competitive landscape of the sleep tech device market.
Analysis of competitive intensity of the industry based on Porter's Five Forces model.
Sleep Tech Device Market Insights
Hospital is expected to witness the highest growth over the forecast period due to higher tendency to deliver exceptional customer satisfaction.
North America will remain the largest region over the forecast period because of the region's robust healthcare facility infrastructure, the market's strongholds, and the growing volume of research being conducted there.

title: Tech Alpharetta Welcomes Six New Members to Strategic Board of Directors
author: Business Wire
excerpt: ALPHARETTA, Ga., May 21, 2024--Tech Alpharetta, the nonprofit organization helping the City of Alpharetta lead in innovation, announces the appointment of six new members to its Strategic Board of…
summary:
New Executive Leaders Appointed to 48-Person Board
ALPHARETTA, Ga., May 21, 2024--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Tech Alpharetta, the nonprofit organization helping the City of Alpharetta lead in innovation, announces the appointment of six new members to its Strategic Board of Directors. Tech Alpharetta's Board is comprised of the area's leading senior executives and is focused on conceptualizing and guiding strategies for growing the Alpharetta technology ecosystem.
Tech Alpharetta's Board features local c-suite, senior executives, city leaders and community partners. The newest Board members include:
Sunita Arora, Chief Operating Officer, Medicus IT
Brad Chason, Senior Vice President of Information Technology, Jackson Healthcare
Avi Malhotra, Executive at Business Transformation Office for Digital & Analytics, Cox Communications
Kevan Williamson, Chief Technology Officer, Georgia's Own Credit Union
Afshean Talasaz, SVP, OE&I (Optimization, Efficiency & Innovation) and Chief Technology & Data Officer, Colonial Pipeline
Brian Will, CEO of Brian Will Media and Alpharetta City Councilman, Post 2
"We are thrilled to welcome six driven and talented leaders to our Strategic Board," says Karen Cashion, President and CEO of Tech Alpharetta. "These leaders lay the foundation for our continued success, propelling the growth of technology and innovation in Alpharetta."
Since its establishment in 2012, Tech Alpharetta and its Board have advised the city of Alpharetta on tech infrastructure and have helped to build Alpharetta's thriving ecosystem. The Board's recommendations led to the launch of Tech Alpharetta's Innovation Center and many other notable accomplishments.
For more information about Tech Alpharetta and its Innovation Center, visit www.techalpharetta.com.
About Tech Alpharetta
Tech Alpharetta (previously the Alpharetta Technology Commission), the first organization of its kind in Georgia, was established in 2012 by the City of Alpharetta and is an independent, 501(c)(6) nonprofit organization today. The organization, whose mission is to help grow technology and innovation in Alpharetta, includes a strategic advisory board of Alpharetta's leading technology companies, and provides technology thought leadership events for area tech executives, a STEAM mentoring program for high school students, technical and leadership development courses through its Tech Studio initiative, and the Tech Alpharetta Innovation Center, a flourishing tech startup incubator that is home to more than 50 tech startups.

KHARAGPUR, WEST BENGAL, INDIA, June 8, 2024 / EINPresswire.com / -- Taylor Hatt, a graphic designer, has taken the digital marketing world by storm with his company, Suprai Tech LLC. This cutting-edge agency is dedicated to providing AI-driven digital marketing solutions that cater to businesses of all sizes. By integrating AI technology into their services, the company offers a range of solutions designed to optimize marketing efforts and drive results. Whether it's a small local business or a large multinational corporation, Suprai Tech LLC has the tools and expertise to help clients achieve their goals.
One of the standout features of Suprai Tech LLC's approach is its focus on personalization. Traditional marketing methods often rely on a one-size-fits-all approach, but Suprai Tech LLC recognizes that every business is unique. Through AI-driven analytics and insights, the company creates customized marketing strategies tailored to each client's specific needs. 'Our mission at Suprai Tech LLC is to empower businesses with innovative marketing solutions that drive growth and success,' said Taylor Hatt, CEO of Suprai Tech LLC. The range of services offered by Suprai Tech LLC is comprehensive, covering everything from social media management and content creation to SEO optimization and digital advertising. The company's AI-powered tools analyze vast amounts of data to identify trends, predict customer behavior, and optimize campaigns in real-time. This data-driven approach allows clients to make informed decisions and adjust their strategies on the fly, ensuring maximum impact and ROI.
One of the key benefits of working with Suprai Tech LLC is the ability to streamline and automate various aspects of digital marketing. For example, the company's AI tools can handle tasks such as scheduling social media posts, analyzing engagement metrics, and even generating content ideas. This not only saves clients valuable time but also ensures that their marketing efforts are consistent and effective.
In addition to its cutting-edge technology, Suprai Tech LLC prides itself on its commitment to customer service. Taylor Hatt and his team work closely with each client to understand their unique challenges and objectives. This collaborative approach ensures that every marketing strategy is aligned with the client's vision and goals. Clients can expect ongoing support and guidance, with regular updates and performance reviews to track progress and make necessary adjustments.
Suprai Tech LLC's success stories speak for themselves. From helping small businesses increase their online visibility to driving substantial growth for larger enterprises, the company has a proven track record of delivering results. Clients consistently praise the company's ability to transform their marketing efforts and achieve significant improvements in engagement, leads, and sales.
As the digital marketing landscape continues to evolve, Suprai Tech LLC remains at the forefront of innovation. Taylor Hatt's visionary leadership and dedication to staying ahead of the curve ensure that the company will continue to offer groundbreaking solutions that drive success for businesses of all sizes.

title: Outstaffer Tackling Tech Talent Shortage in APAC
author: Business Wire
excerpt: MELBOURNE, Australia, May 27, 2024--As Australia aims to reach 1.2 million tech workers by 2030, significant challenges remain. Despite recent migration reforms, the Tech Council of Australia reports…
summary:
MELBOURNE, Australia, May 27, 2024--(BUSINESS WIRE)--As Australia aims to reach 1.2 million tech workers by 2030, significant challenges remain. Despite recent migration reforms, the Tech Council of Australia reports that 160,000 young Australians need training to enter the tech workforce.
"While Australia punches above its weight in founding local tech companies that are globally successful, only 1% of Australia's tech workforce has scale-up experience, compared to 17% in Singapore," states TCA CEO, Kate Pounder.
The global tech skills shortage, intensified by the pandemic and rapid digital transformation, has heightened the need for innovative hiring strategies. Border closures further restricted access to overseas talent, increasing the urgency for effective solutions.
Outstaffer, a leading full-service global EOR, announces its upcoming virtual webinar, "Hiring Great Tech Talent in APAC," which will address the tech talent shortage in Australia and the APAC region. The event will be held on Thursday, June 20, 2024, from 12:30 PM to 1:30 PM AEST via Zoom.
The webinar will feature insights from industry experts:
Kellie Shaffier, CEO at HR Shop, Dave Kuhn, CTO at Outstaffer and Ronny Haughton, Co-Founder at The Onset
Event Details:
Date and Time : Thursday, June 20, 2024 from 12:30 PM - 1:30 PM (AEST)
Location: Zoom Webinar
Attendees will learn about accessing global tech talent, navigating compliance, integrating remote teams, anticipating future tech roles and skills, and leveraging cultural diversity for innovation.
Registration:
To register, visit the Event Registration Link.
About Outstaffer:
Outstaffer helps businesses overcome tech talent shortages by providing innovative hiring solutions and support for integrating global tech talent. Focused on compliance, diversity, and future-proofing workforce strategies, Outstaffer leads the transformation in tech hiring.

title: 10 Clever Ways to Earn Money by Writing Reviews on Tech Products
author: Hillary
excerpt: The tech industry is booming, and with it, the demand for authentic reviews on tech products has surged. Many consumers rely on detailed reviews to make informed purchasing decisions. If you love tech…
summary:
The tech industry is booming, and with it, the demand for authentic reviews on tech products has surged. Many consumers rely on detailed reviews to make informed purchasing decisions. If you love tech and have a knack for writing, there are numerous ways to monetize your reviews. Here are ten clever ways to earn money by writing reviews on tech products.
Start a Tech Review Blog One of the most straightforward ways to earn money from tech reviews is by starting your own blog. Create a website where you can post detailed reviews of the latest gadgets, software, and tech accessories. Use search engine optimization (SEO) strategies to attract traffic to your blog. Monetize it through advertisements, sponsored posts, and affiliate marketing.
Join Affiliate Programs Affiliate marketing is a popular method to earn money by promoting tech products. Sign up for affiliate programs with companies like Amazon, Best Buy, or tech-specific retailers. Write reviews and include affiliate links to the products. When readers click on these links and make a purchase, you earn a commission. This can be particularly lucrative if your reviews attract a large audience.
Write for Tech Websites and Magazines Many tech websites and magazines are willing to pay for high-quality reviews. Pitch your ideas to editors of well-known tech publications. Writing for established sites not only provides an income but also helps build your reputation as a credible reviewer. Look for opportunities with websites like TechRadar, CNET, and Wired.
Create a YouTube Channel Video content is incredibly popular, and YouTube is a great platform to share tech reviews. Start a YouTube channel where you post video reviews of the latest tech products. Monetize your channel through ads, sponsorships, and affiliate marketing. Engaging video content can attract a large following, leading to substantial earnings.
Use Social Media Platforms Social media is a powerful tool for reaching a wide audience. Platforms like Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook allow you to share quick reviews and engage with followers. Use these platforms to drive traffic to your blog or YouTube channel. Brands often pay influencers to review their products, providing another income stream.
Participate in Review Programs Many tech companies have review programs where they send products to reviewers for free. While these programs often don't pay directly, they provide you with the latest tech gadgets to review. You can then monetize your reviews through your blog, YouTube channel, or social media platforms. Programs like Amazon Vine and Best Buy's Tech Insider Network are good places to start.
Freelance Writing Freelance writing offers flexibility and the potential for a steady income. Platforms like Upwork, Freelancer, and Fiverr have numerous opportunities for tech review writers. You can find gigs writing reviews for blogs, websites, and even product descriptions for e-commerce sites. Set competitive rates and build a portfolio to attract more clients.
Write E-books and Guides If you have extensive knowledge about tech products, consider writing e-books or guides. You can sell these on platforms like Amazon Kindle Direct Publishing or your own website. E-books that provide in-depth reviews and buying guides for specific types of tech products can attract readers and generate passive income over time.
Host Webinars and Workshops Sharing your expertise through webinars and workshops can be highly profitable. Offer sessions where you review and compare tech products, providing valuable insights to attendees. Charge a fee for access to these events or offer premium content to paying members. This method not only generates income but also establishes you as an authority in the tech review space.
Join Review Websites Some websites pay users to write reviews. Platforms like G2 Crowd, Trustpilot, and Influenster offer incentives for detailed and honest reviews. While these sites may not always focus exclusively on tech products, they often have opportunities to review software, gadgets, and other tech-related items. This can be a good way to earn extra money while building your review portfolio.
Conclusion Earning money by writing reviews on tech products is a viable option for tech enthusiasts and skilled writers. Whether you choose to start a blog, join affiliate programs, create a YouTube channel, or write for established tech websites, there are numerous ways to monetize your passion for tech. By leveraging social media, participating in review programs, freelancing, writing e-books, hosting webinars, and joining review websites, you can diversify your income streams and build a successful career in tech reviews.
Artificial intelligence, digital marketing, Writng Reviews On Tech Products

title: In the region: Tech women to host Radford; Tech men to host Navy
author: The Roanoke Times
excerpt: Plus more basketball news.
summary:
The Roanoke Times
The Roanoke Times The Virginia Tech women's basketball team will host Radford on Dec. 15, while the Tech men's basketball team will host Navy that same day.
The Roanoke Times obtained from Tech the contracts for some nonconference games that have not yet been announced by Tech, including those two games.
Tech will pay Radford $25,000 for the Dec. 15 women's basketball game. Tech squashed its New River Valley rival 85-40 last season.
The Tech women will host Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference member Coppin State on Nov. 16. Tech will pay Coppin $20,000. Tech won 85-32 when the teams last met in November 2021.
The Tech women, who won at Rutgers last season, will host Rutgers this season to complete the home-and-home deal.
The Virginia Tech men will host Navy on Dec. 15. Tech will pay Navy $90,000. Tech won 77-57 when the teams last met in the Veterans Classic at Navy in November 2021.
The Tech men will host CAA member North Carolina A&T on Dec. 12. Tech will pay A&T $95,000. Tech beat A&T 82-60 when the teams last met in December 2018.
The full Tech men's and women's nonleague schedules have not yet been announced.
As previously reported, Tech will be paid $150,000 by Charlotte Sports Events for the women's rematch against Iowa on Nov. 10 in Charlotte.
As previously reported, Tech will be paid $30,000 by Position Sports for the Tech men to play Penn State in Baltimore on Nov. 15 in a Hall of Fame Series doubleheader.
As previously announced, the men's teams from Tech, Michigan, Xavier and South Carolina will play in the Beach Division of the Fort Myers Tip-Off tournament in Florida on Nov. 25 and Nov. 27. The pairings have not yet been announced. Tech will also host a yet-to-be-named school from the other division in the on-campus portion of that event.
VMI to play in Greenbrier tourney VMI will play in the inaugural Greenbrier Tip-Off Tournament, which will be held Nov. 15-16 at The Greenbrier in West Virginia.
The Keydets will be in the River Division with Charleston Southern, Tennessee Tech and Texas-Rio Grande Valley. The pairings have not been announced.
A separate champ will be crowned in the Mountain Division, which will feature Wisconsin, Pittsburgh, LSU and Central Florida.
Radford to play in Daytona tourney Radford will play in the Sunshine Slam, which will be held Nov. 25-26 at the Ocean Center in Daytona Beach, Fla.
The Highlanders will be in the Ocean bracket with Chicago State, Drexel and Purdue-Fort Wayne. The pairings have not been announced.
A separate champ will be crowned in the Beach bracket, which features Clemson, Penn State, San Francisco and Fordham.

title: London Tech Week day two: How can tech help solve the climate crisis?
author: Russ Shaw
excerpt: As London Tech Week kicks off, Russ Shaw gives us the inside scoop on the industry with his daily diary
summary:
London Tech Week day two: How can tech help solve the climate crisis?
As London Tech Week kicks off, Russ Shaw, founder of Tech London Advocates & Global Tech Advocates, gives us the inside scoop on the industry with his daily diary
A central question in the tech ecosystem is what can tech do to solve the climate crisis.
Technology is rightly considered a powerful asset when approaching the target of net-zero, providing the innovative solutions required, backed by investor confidence.
Recent L&P research found that London-based Climate Tech startups raised $3.5bn, ranking second globally in terms of investment in the sector. More broadly, the sector has a current turnover of £344.6bn and is growing at 11.1 per cent per year.
To put things in perspective, the UK cleantech sector is three times the size it was in 2017.
These numbers speak volumes , and a clear demonstration of the economic incentive that is coupled with the moral case for urgently finding solutions to the climate crisis, recognising tech as fundamental to the UK's path to net-zero.
London (Clean)tech Week
London (Clean)tech Week
It comes as no surprise that at London Tech Week this year, there is a commitment to sustainability, with the event working to achieve carbon net-zero and zero waste.
As tech experts from over 100 countries gather in London this week, they will engage with themes addressing today's most pressing issues, showcasing how technology can positively impact society.
The focus on a sustainable future at the UK's biggest tech event aims to inspire attendees by providing a platform for decision-makers, industry leaders, and entrepreneurs to implement change.
Today, attendees at Olympia heard from ClimateTech founders and CEOs, from companies including ENSO and Materials Nexus, as part of a green-focused speaker line-up with the message of providing a better future for our planet through technology.
In the festival's fringe events I attended today with Tech in Ghana, Tech Malaysia Advocates and Tech China Advocates, sustainability was a theme across the board. Each group spoke about the importance of net-zero, how we can look after the planet and underlined how tech for net-zero is something that we must work together on to achieve global sustainability goals.
Furthermore, the ClimateTech Summit returns to London Tech Week once again this year, with speakers from the SOSV, National Grid and Katapult all set to offer their insights.
These convening moments all restate the commitment of the tech sector to putting the planet at the forefront of tech decision-making.
How tech can lead the green-way
How tech can lead the green-way
The incentive to position London tech at the heart of our fight against climate change goes beyond the moral argument – though that of course plays a major role too.
London is respected, and renowned around the world, for its approach to climate tech – the fact that investment in climate tech in the UK was only second globally is clear testament to that fact. This tech vertical is a significant asset that brings in billions in investment yearly and has the potential to create thousands of jobs around the country.
Addressing climate change requires innovative solutions – an area in which tech clearly shines. Just today, high-level representatives from IBM, AVEVA and Cognizant discussed potential usage of AI in reaching a ‘sustainable future'.
These are conversations that demonstrate the very best uses of transformational technologies that stand at the frontier of innovation, and it is great to see London Tech Week acting as a crucial facilitator of such insight sharing.
No time to waste
No time to waste
Ultimately, we are behind in the climate fight.
The time for tech in the path to net-zero is now, as it was when hydroelectricity – the first renewable energy source – was created, when wind turbines were manufactured in the late 1800s, or when solar panels were first used in the 1950s.
This is tech's moment, and we have an opportunity to push ahead with the climate fight by doubling down on climate tech and the benefits it can deliver.
We need to use moments like this week, with 45,000 tech leaders all gathering in London, to galvanise progress and plan how we can accelerate the tech innovation that will shape a sustainable, green future.
Moments like London Tech Week have the power to inspire solutions and drive forward the urgent action needed to combat climate change.
Russ Shaw CBE is the founder of Tech London Advocates & Global Tech Advocates
Russ Shaw CBE is the founder of Tech London Advocates & Global Tech Advocates

title: Best Buy Canada Introduces Teen Tech for Tomorrow
author: CNW Group
excerpt: Best Buy Canada is announcing Teen Tech for Tomorrow, a new social impact initiative that provides Canadian teens with the latest tech they need to learn and succeed.
summary:
Teen Tech for Tomorrow is an exciting new program aimed at improving tech equity for Canadian teens.Applications are open now until June 28.
VANCOUVER, BC, June 6, 2024 /CNW/ - Best Buy Canada is announcing Teen Tech for Tomorrow, a new social impact initiative that provides Canadian teens with the latest tech they need to learn and succeed.
The program includes the following.
Teen Tech Grants. Grants of up to $10,000 for Canadian public secondary schools to provide educational tech for students from Grades 8 to 12, and for the opportunity to be part of the Best Buy Teen Tech Network.
Teen Tech Network. All Teen Tech Grant recipients will become members of this national community of teens and schools, who can collaborate on projects and compete for ongoing funding, prizes, and technology.
Teen Tech Teams. Grants for high-school level robotics teams to purchase materials and equipment to attend a robotics competition in the 2024/25 season. Through a partnership with Alienware, each winning team will receive a $5,000 grant and one Alienware M16 R2 gaming laptop.
Teen Tech Centre. Canada's first Teen Tech Centre is located in a BGC Canada club in Delta, B.C. Best Buy Teen Tech Centres are free, safe, after-school spaces equipped with professional level technology, giving teens the opportunity to create hands-on projects and learn new skills. There are currently 60 Teen Tech Centres across North America, with plans to reach 100 over the next few years.
Applications for Teen Tech Grants and Teen Tech Teams are open now until June 28.
"We've identified teens as a group that we can significantly impact by creating more access to technology and training," says Jen Knight, Best Buy Canada's Social Impact Manager. "Through our new Teen Tech for Tomorrow program, our goal is to provide hands-on technology to youth at a time when they're considering post-secondary education and future careers. We're very excited to equip Canadian students with the tech they need to unlock their potential and pursue their dreams."
Best Buy Canada focuses its social impact efforts on building brighter futures through technology. Since 2008, the company has given more than $4 million in grants to over 300 Canadian public schools for upgrades to classroom technology. By providing funding to purchase the tech that students need, as well as creating opportunities for schools across the country to connect and learn, Teen Tech for Tomorrow will bridge the digital divide in a new and impactful way.
To learn more about Teen Tech for Tomorrow, watch this video: Introducing Teen Tech for Tomorrow (youtube.com) To learn more about Teen Tech Grants, visit: www.BestBuy.ca/teentechgrants To learn more about Teen Tech Teams, visit: www.BestBuy.ca/teentechteams For more information about Best Buy Canada's social impact efforts, visit: www.BestBuy.ca/socialimpact
About Best Buy Canada
A wholly owned subsidiary of Best Buy Co., Inc. (NYSE: BBY), Best Buy Canada Ltd. is one of Canada's largest and most innovative omnichannel retailers, operating the Best Buy, Best Buy Mobile, and Geek Squad (www.geeksquad.ca) brands. With over 160 Best Buy and Best Buy Mobile stores across Canada and an expanded assortment of lifestyle products offered through BestBuy.ca, Best Buy is a leader in total retail, catering to customers how, when, and where they want to shop. Best Buy Canada is committed to making a positive impact in the community with programs and partnerships that support youth to connect with technology to advance their education. For more information, visit BestBuy.ca.
SOURCE Best Buy Canada

In this comprehensive guide, we'll explore the most impactful tech trends and innovations that are shaping the future of technology.
Introduction: Embracing the Digital Frontier

From artificial intelligence to blockchain, the possibilities are endless. Join us on a journey through the ever-changing world of technology as we explore the trends and innovations that are shaping our future.
5 Breakthrough Technologies Shaping the Future
Artificial Intelligence (AI): From self-driving cars to personalized recommendations, AI is revolutionizing industries and changing the way we live and work. Internet of Things (IoT): With billions of connected devices, the IoT is transforming everything from healthcare to transportation. Blockchain: Beyond cryptocurrencies, blockchain technology has the potential to revolutionize industries such as finance, supply chain management, and healthcare. Virtual Reality (VR): VR is no longer just for gaming. From virtual meetings to immersive training simulations, VR is finding applications across various sectors. Augmented Reality (AR): AR overlays digital information onto the real world, offering new possibilities for entertainment, education, and commerce. Unveiling the Next Big Thing: Emerging Tech Innovations

From AI to VR: Exploring the Future of Technology

Tech Titans: Inside the World's Most Influential Tech Companies

How [Specific Technology] Is Revolutionizing [Industry/Field]
From healthcare to finance, technology is revolutionizing every industry. In this section, we'll explore how specific technologies are revolutionizing various industries, from AI in healthcare to blockchain in finance.
The Rise of [Specific Tech Trend]: What You Need to Know
In this section, we'll explore the rise of specific tech trends, from the Internet of Things to cybersecurity. We'll discuss what these trends mean for the future of technology and how they're shaping our world.
Deep Dive: Understanding Blockchain Technology and Its Impact

Tech Breakthroughs: A Look at the Latest Research and Development
In this section, we'll explore the latest tech breakthroughs, from AI-powered robots to self-driving cars. We'll discuss how these breakthroughs are shaping the future of technology and what they mean for society.
The Tech Revolution: Where Are We Headed?
The tech revolution is in full swing, with new innovations emerging every day. In this section, we'll explore where the tech revolution is headed and what the future holds for technology and society.
Navigating the Digital Age: Essential Tech Tips and Tricks
In this section, we'll provide essential tech tips and tricks for navigating the digital age. From staying safe online to boosting productivity, these tips will help you make the most of technology in your daily life.
From Sci-Fi to Reality: Incredible Tech Innovations That Exist Today
From self-driving cars to 3D-printed organs, incredible tech innovations that once seemed like science fiction are now a reality. In this section, we'll explore some of these incredible innovations and their impact on society.
Demystifying [Specific Tech Term]: Everything You Need to Know

title: 2024 Wisconsin Tech Month looks to widen its reach
author: David Schuyler
excerpt: Wisconsin Tech Month is dedicated to increasing diversity in tech.
summary:
Organizers behind Wisconsin Tech Month events have designated the last week in October as a time to foster connections between tech-focused organizations among neighboring states.
From the beginning, Wisconsin Tech Month was organized by Milky Way Tech Hub, a Milwaukee group focused on equitably growing the city's tech ecosystem, and Milwaukee's Latinos in Tech, established to connect Latino tech leaders. In time, the groups took over Milwaukee Tech Week, a separate program once known as Startup Milwaukee Week.
Milky Way Tech Hub is the social impact arm of Jet Constellations, the software development company founded by Nadiyah Johnson. Latinos in Tech was co-founded by Ben Juarez and Carlos Vasquez.
This year, October will launch with Milwaukee Tech Week featuring events focused on tech policy and advocacy in southeast Wisconsin, followed by a week focused on community engagement, with an emphasis on women in technology.
Week three focuses on STEM education and workforce development, and the fourth and final week will be Midwest Tech Week.
As a Black and Latino-led initiative, Wisconsin Tech Month is dedicated to increasing diversity in tech.
This year, organizers are making a dedicated effort to reach tech companies and leaders in northeast Wisconsin. That effort is exemplified by the month's launch event, the Wisconsin Tech Month Kick-Off Social being held at Fox Cities Stadium in Appleton in conjunction with Women in Technology and Amplify Oshkosh.
Here are some of the events during Wisconsin Tech Month. See the full schedule.

title: TurnKey Tech Staffing Releases In-Depth Analysis of Colombia's Tech Hiring Market
excerpt: TurnKey Tech Staffing, the #1 offshore tech staffing firm, has released an in-depth analysis of Colombia's tech hiring market. This comprehensive research of
summary:
MENLO PARK, CALIFORNIA, UNITED STATES, June 18, 2024 /EINPresswire.com/ -- TurnKey Tech Staffing, the #1 offshore tech staffing firm, has released an in-depth analysis of Colombia's tech hiring market. This comprehensive research of the Colombian tech scene – called 'Colombia: Tech Talent Overview' – explores the reasons behind the country becoming one of the most popular offshore destinations for hiring software developers. It serves as a guideline for every tech company that is considering if and how to tap into the Colombian tech talent pool.
With thousands of highly qualified bilingual software developers, influential tech hubs like Bogotá and Medellín, and strong governmental support for software development, the Colombian tech market is increasingly popular with U.S.-based startups and fast-growing tech companies.
The report gives a robust overview of the Colombian tech workforce and answers the following questions: - How many developers are there in Colombia, and what is the state of the Colombian tech market? - What are the demographics of an average Colombian developer, and what motivates them the most? - What key skills does the Colombian tech workforce possess? - What programming languages are most popular among Colombian developers? - What are the main challenges of hiring Colombian developers, and how can you handle them?
- How should you approach cultural differences when adding Colombian developers to your U.S.-based development team?
The report is written by TurnKey Tech Staffing, the #1 offshore tech staffing firm. TurnKey's unique staffing model combines expert recruiting of the Top 3% of developers in Eastern Europe and Latin America with no-hassle Employer of Record services that handle all the legal, payroll, and administrative headaches of employing and paying offshore developers.
More specifically, TurnKey Tech Staffing is the only company in its category that delivers the four most important pillars of offshore hiring success: - Developers that are custom-recruited for each client; - A world-class talent retention program that reduces developer churn by more than 50%; - Complete price transparency about all salaries and fees;

title: OJEE Result 2024 out at ojee.nic.in: Check toppers' list and direct link to download rank card
author: Deepto Banerjee
excerpt: News News: OJEE Result 2024 announced, direct link to check here. The Odisha Joint Entrance Examination Committee announced results today, June 3, for OJEE 2024.
summary:
OJEE Result 2024:
The Odisha Joint Entrance Examination Committee has released the OJEE 2024 results today on June 3. Candidates who participated in the Odisha Joint Entrance Examination (OJEE) can view their results on the official website at ojee.nic.in.
The OJEE 2024 was conducted from May 6 to May 10 in a computer-based test (CBT) format for various technical and professional courses, including B.Pharma, LE-Tech (Diploma), LE-Tech (B.Sc.), B.CAT, MBA, MCA, Integrated MBA, LE-Pharm, M.Arch, M.Plan, and M.Tech.
These courses are offered by different government and private institutes and universities across the state. This year, 65,742 candidates registered for the examination, and 56,047 candidates appeared for the test.
To download the OJEE 2024 result, applicants will need their login credentials, such as their application number and password.
How to check OJEE Rank Card 2024?
Here's a step by step guide to download Odisha JEE rank card 2024-
Step 1:
Go to the official website ojee.nic.in.
Step 2:
Look for the OJEE Result 2024 link on the homepage.
Step 3:
Click on the link to open a PDF displaying the results.
Step 4:
Locate your name in the result list.
Step 5:
Save the PDF and print a copy for your records.
Step 6:
It's recommended to keep both a digital and printed copy of the result for future reference.

title: Senior Chinese official urges promotion of sci-tech advancement
excerpt: BEIJING, June 25 (Xinhua) -- Ding Xuexiang, director of China's central science and technology commission, on Tuesday urged efforts to continue to promote sci-tech progress, with focus on strategic…
summary:
BEIJING, June 25 (Xinhua) -- Ding Xuexiang, director of China's central science and technology commission, on Tuesday urged efforts to continue to promote sci-tech progress, with focus on strategic objectives and key tasks.
Ding, also a member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Communist Party of China Central Committee, made a speech at the second plenary session of a meeting conflating the national sci-tech conference and the general assemblies of the members of the Chinese Academy of Sciences and the Chinese Academy of Engineering.
Ding said that it is necessary to promote sci-tech innovation via a new nationwide system, identify major research tasks, consolidate the foundation of basic research, and accelerate research concerning key core technologies.
He also called for using sci-tech innovation to accelerate the development of new quality productive forces, strengthen the dominant position of enterprises in sci-tech innovation, and promote the deep integration of sci-tech and industrial innovations.
Ding emphasized the need to inject impetus into sci-tech innovation by deepening institutional reform, refining policies and systems, and strengthening the coordination of resources.
China will work with the rest of the world to promote sci-tech progress and innovative development through opening up and cooperation, expand exchanges and cooperation in all areas, and build an open environment for sci-tech innovation with global competitiveness, he said. ■

summary:
Virginia Tech Hokies
The matchup between Virginia Tech and Georgia Tech is arguably the most anticipated in-conference ACC game this week. Both of these teams have had incredibly high expectations at times.
Heading into week one, Georgia Tech was riding high after a walk-off win against No. 10 Florida State, a team that at the time seemed much better than what is known now. The Jackets were ranked afterwards, ending a 9-year drought tracing back to September 20, 2015.
The Hokies were also close to being ranked by the AP Poll this year, after receiving 77 votes in the intial poll, placing Virginia Tech at 27th in votes, just behind ACC foe Louisville, who was placed at 26th. Since that preseason poll, the Hokies season has been as up-and-down as it gets. The Hokies were upset by Vanderbilt and Rutgers in the first four weeks of the season, then played in a game that went to the referee's discretion against No. 7 Miami, and dominated Stanford and Boston College, 31-7 and 42-21 respectively.
These seasons have been very different for the 'Tech' schools, but both teams have three losses heading into 2024's TechMo Bowl, and Virginia Tech is listed as a 10.5-point favorite at DraftKings Sportsbook.
Here's how we think Virginia Tech's matchup against Georgia Tech will go.

title: How Chicago ranks when it comes to tech talent
excerpt: For the second year in a row, Chicago did not crack the top 20 for "tech talent" in the United States and Canada, according to CBRE.
summary:
For the second year in a row, Chicago did not crack the top 20 for "tech talent" in the United States and Canada, according to CBRE.
Chicago doesn't have the highest-paid tech workers. Nor is its workforce dominated by tech employees, especially when compared with other tech hubs.
For the second year in a row, the city did not crack the top 20 for "tech talent" in the United States and Canada, according to CBRE.
The annual report on tech workforce demographics in the U.S. and Canada ranked Chicago No. 23 among the top 50 markets and No. 17 in the United States when looking at the overall strength of its tech talent, based on 13 metrics measuring depth, vitality and attractiveness to companies. The top-ranked talent markets for tech included the San Francisco Bay Area, Seattle, New York City, Toronto and Austin.
CREATE YOUR FREE ACCOUNT
BECOME A MEMBER
Join the Chicago Business Journal to unlock even more insights!
Email Address *
Password * Show
Zip Code * Join Now Sign-in | Premium Memberships
By submitting your information you are agreeing to our Privacy Policy and User Agreement.
Between office rents and salaries, often the two biggest expenses for tech companies, Chicago is the 15th most-expensive place to run a tech business, costing less than other major metros such as Los Angeles and New York City. Chicago was also considered one of the top education markets as one of a handful of markets with more graduates with tech degrees than jobs for tech talent.
In terms of overall tech talent, Chicago's workforce of more than 160,000 workers ranked 10th in the country but saw a 9.5% decrease from 2018 to 2023.
Other highlights:
Tech talent concentration in Chicago — or the percentage of tech employees as a share of total employment — continues to be low (3.6%) compared with other markets, such as San Francisco (12.3%) and Seattle (9.4%).
Among large tech-talent markets, only Washington, D.C., lost more employees from 2018 to 2023 — 19,000 — than Chicago, which lost 16,790.
Tech companies pay wages about 17% above the U.S. average. In Chicago, tech workers make $98,513 on average, the 12th-highest in the country and nearly half the annual wage as San Francisco Bay Area ($192,969).
Chicago ranked 10th in terms of apartment rents, with an average cost of $1,966, an increase of 19% over the last five years.
CBRE's report also noted the push toward artificial intelligence that continues among tech companies across the U.S. Overall, U.S. tech talent employment grew by 3.6%, or by 213,000 jobs, in 2023, marking a significant slowdown from 2022 when tech talent grew 7.3%. But AI-related jobs increased at double the pace of the rest of tech. While larger markets such as San Francisco and New York have the most AI-specialty talent, Chicago had the ninth-largest share in the U.S.

title: Friday Flyover: Lane Tech High School
excerpt: This week, ABC7 Chicago is featuring Lane Tech High School on Friday Flyover.
summary:
Friday Flyover: Lane Tech High School
CHICAGO (WLS) -- This week, ABC7 Chicago is featuring Lane Tech High School on Friday Flyover.
Lane Tech College Prep Facts:
-According to Chicago Magazine, Lane Tech is currently ranked 3rd in Chicago's best public high schools reader poll.
-Lane Tech is currently ranked 5th in Illinois according to US News and World Report.
-Lane Tech's Flag Football team won the state championship for 2023-24 school year.
-Lane Tech offers 33 Advanced Placement courses.
-Lane Tech had 16 National Merit Scholars in 2023-2024
-Lane Tech had 18 Semi-Final National Merit Scholars in 2023-2024
-Lane Tech has 68 different native languages spoken by our student body.
-Lane Tech Sports Lane Tech 2023-24 Sports City Championships:
-Lane Tech earned 23 City Championships for 2023-24 school year.
STATE ACHIEVEMENTS:
Girls Flag Football State Championship
Dance Team Hip Hop State Championship
SECTIONAL Champs = Boys Tennis
REGIONAL Champs = Wrestling, Boys Bowling, Girls Soccer, Boys Volleyball
LANE TECH CHESS TEAM:
The Lane Tech Chess Team has a long and proud history. In 1969 the Lane Tech Chess Team traveled to New York City and won the first ever National High School Chess Championship. In 2003 the Lane Tech Girls Chess Team won the first ever All-Girls National High School Chess Championship. Last year, the Lane Tech Chess Team finished 8th in state out of 130 teams competing in the IHSA State Championship Tournament. Our team is led by seniors Avi Kaplan and Whitman Kosak and we're looking to build on our strong finish from last year for an even better tournament this year.
LANE TECH ACADEC:
Lane Tech has been competing in the United States Academic Decathlon since the program's inception in 1985. Since then, Lane has made a name for itself by consistently placing second in the City Championship and State Championship competitions. These past two years Lane's team has proudly represented the school of champions at the National Championship competition. This past year in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania Lane's team made history by placing 1st in our division. We are NATIONAL CHAMPIONS!!! Our current team is led by student captain Elijah Jackson (class of 2025) and officer Em Molina (class of 2025). We are ready to make history again this year, taking on Whitney Young for the City and State titles this upcoming spring. Go Lane Go!!
LANE TECH JROTC
:
1.2 million dollars in scholarships were received by Lane Tech students in 2024.
LANE TECH BIRTHDAY CELEBRATION:
Lane Tech just celebrated their 90th birthday at Lane Tech campus on Addison! Lane Tech originally opened on the corner of Sedgwick and Division in 1908. Lane Tech was ALL BOYS until 1971. Lane Tech's SY 2024-25 enrollment is 4,599.
OLAS:
OLAS is the Organization of Latin American Students and is one of the International Day's Clubs here at Lane Tech. OLAS competes year round and just recently won the The Chicago Salsa Congress for the 7th time. title: The Influence Of EB1A Green Card On A Tech Professional's Journey For tech professionals aiming to establish their careers in the United States, securing an EB1A green card can be a game-changer. This prestigious category, established by the U.S.
author: Jitender Bhagat
excerpt: For tech professionals aiming to establish their careers in the United States, securing an EB1A green card can be a game-changer. This prestigious category, established by the U.S.
summary:
For tech professionals aiming to establish their careers in the United States, securing an EB1A green card can be a game-changer. This prestigious category, established by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS), offers a path to permanent residency for individuals who demonstrate exceptional talent and significant achievements in their field. While meeting the EB1A criteria requires careful preparation, partnering with specialized firms like us at EB1A Experts can significantly increase the chances of success.
Impact on tech Professionals' Careers
An EB1A green card can dramatically transform a tech professional's career landscape in the United States. It provides the stability and freedom to pursue cutting-edge projects, lead innovative teams, or launch tech startups without the constraints of temporary visas. This newfound security allows tech professionals to focus on pushing technological boundaries and making substantial contributions to their field.
Moreover, EB1A status elevates a tech professional's standing within the industry. It is a testament to their notable skills and accomplishments, potentially leading to leadership roles, speaking engagements at major tech conferences, and collaborations with industry giants. The flexibility to work for any U.S. tech company or start their venture without sponsorship empowers these professionals to chart their course in the rapidly evolving tech sector.
Long-term benefits for professional and personal growth
The advantages of an EB1A green card extend far beyond immediate career prospects. Tech professionals can establish enduring relationships with industry leaders, venture capitalists, and fellow innovators. This stability fosters an environment conducive to long-term research and development projects, which is crucial in the tech industry.
On a personal level, the EB1A green card offers tech professionals and their families a sense of permanence. They can confidently invest in their future in the U.S., whether purchasing property in tech hubs, enrolling children in top schools, or actively participating in local tech communities.
Navigating the EB1A process with EB1A Experts
While the benefits of an EB1A green card are substantial, meeting the USCIS criteria can be challenging for many talented tech professionals. This is where we at EB1A Experts prove invaluable. We specialize in building firm EB1A profiles and have a proven track record of helping tech professionals succeed in their green card applications.
We stand out because we deeply understand how a tech professional's achievements align with EB1A criteria.
Our comprehensive approach involves:
1. Evaluating the tech professional's background, including critical projects, product innovations, and industry recognition.
2. Providing strategic guidance in gathering compelling evidence that showcases technological innovations and their impact.
3. Crafting an impactful narrative highlighting the tech professional's significant abilities and contributions to the field.
What sets us apart is our ability to build profiles that meet not just three but up to 8-9 of the ten EB1A criteria set by USCIS. This thorough approach significantly reduces the chances of rejection, making the path to a green card faster and more secure for tech professionals.
By leveraging our specialized knowledge and proven strategies, tech professionals can confidently navigate the complexities of the USCIS application process. Our track record demonstrates success, with numerous tech clients obtaining their EB1A green cards in as little as six months.
By securing an EB1A green card, tech professionals unlock opportunities. They gain the stability to innovate, the credibility to lead, and the flexibility to shape the future of technology in the United States.
For those ready to elevate their careers to new heights, the EB1A path, supported by our expertise at EB1A Experts, offers a compelling route to success in the American tech industry.
Benefits
Faster processing: For tech professionals, EB-1A often offers quicker processing times than other categories. Premium processing can reduce the initial review to 15 business days, crucial in the fast-paced tech industry.
Priority in visa bulletin: The "current" status often benefits tech professionals from countries with high visa demand, like India and China, where many IT experts originate.
Family benefits: Tech professionals' immediate family can also obtain green cards, allowing spouses to work in the tech industry if desired.
Key Takeaways
● A significant number of EB1A green card recipients in the tech sector have gone on to found successful startups or assume leadership roles in substantial tech companies within five years of obtaining their green card.
● The EB1A category allows tech professionals to work on multiple projects or for various employers without restrictions, fostering innovation and technological advancements.

title: How Miami's Tech Boom is Changing the City
author: Angela Scott-Briggs
excerpt: Over the last few years, Miami has transformed from a place known for beaches and nightlife into one of the fastest-growing tech hotspots in the world. With tech investors, startup founders, and…
summary:
Over the last few years, Miami has transformed from a place known for beaches and nightlife into one of the fastest-growing tech hotspots in the world. With tech investors, startup founders, and digital workers flocking to the city, Miami's becoming a hub for innovation and it's reshaping the city in many ways. This article breaks down what this tech boom means for Miami's neighborhoods, housing, jobs, and even its unique culture.
Why Miami? How it Became a Tech Hotspot
Miami's rise in the tech world isn't by accident. The city offers attractive perks like no state income tax, which draws both tech entrepreneurs and big tech companies. Miami's location close to Latin America also makes it a strategic choice for companies with international connections. Plus, the sunny weather and vibrant lifestyle are a big draw for those tired of high-pressure tech hubs like Silicon Valley.
High-profile investors like Peter Thiel and others moving to Miami have helped the city gain credibility in tech circles, attracting millions in venture capital funding for startups. This surge of investment has helped Miami's tech scene grow, bringing major changes to the urban landscape.
Building New Infrastructure for a Tech-Driven City
Miami's buildings and city plans are evolving fast to meet the demands of the growing tech community. Areas like Wynwood, the Design District, and Brickell are filled with new co-working spaces, tech incubators, and creative hubs, attracting talent from all over.
A standout project is the Miami Innovation District, which focuses on creating spaces for tech startups, research labs, and tech events. Alongside these new developments, Miami is working on public transit upgrades and sustainability measures like bike-sharing and 'smart city' tech that monitors traffic and saves energy.
The Housing Challenge: Tech Boom and Rising Rents
With more tech companies and workers in Miami, the demand for housing has shot up, raising prices on homes and apartments. While this boosts the local economy, it also makes housing harder to afford, especially for long-time residents. Developers are building high-end condos and apartments targeting tech professionals, but affordable housing options remain limited, causing some people to be priced out of neighborhoods they've lived in for years.
Miami's government is working with developers to address this by creating affordable units and promoting mixed-income housing. This way, the city can keep its diverse community while welcoming new tech workers.
New Jobs, New Skills: The Impact on Miami's Workforce
Miami's tech scene is creating a wide range of new job opportunities. Beyond startups, traditional industries like banking, healthcare, and tourism are also adding tech positions. This means more high-paying jobs in the city, but many of these roles require specialized skills.
To close the skill gap, Miami's schools and colleges are expanding tech courses in areas like coding and AI. Nonprofits and tech companies are also setting up boot camps and workshops to help residents learn the skills needed to succeed in tech roles. This focus on education means that more locals can take advantage of the city's tech boom, rather than seeing these jobs filled by out-of-state workers.
Blending Tech and Tradition: Miami's Unique Culture
Miami is a cultural melting pot, with influences from Latin America, the Caribbean, and beyond. The tech boom is bringing new ideas, trends, and tastes into the city, changing everything from restaurants to entertainment. However, there's a strong effort to keep Miami's unique identity alive.
Tech events, like coding camps and conferences, are held alongside cultural festivals and community events, creating a blend of new and traditional. Many tech founders are also working with local artists and musicians to create a uniquely Miami tech scene. This mix keeps Miami exciting for both new residents and tourists who want to experience its special vibe.
A Greener Miami: Building with the Environment in Mind
As a coastal city, Miami faces unique environmental challenges. The tech industry's focus on innovation aligns well with Miami's goal to create a climate-friendly city. New buildings are using eco-friendly materials and energy-saving designs. The city is also investing in climate-proof infrastructure to address issues like rising sea levels and hurricane risk.
Miami is introducing solar panels, smart grids, and energy-efficient buildings, aiming to become a leader in sustainable urban development.
Looking Ahead: Miami's Tech Future
Miami's tech scene is just getting started, but it's already changing the city's skyline, job market, and culture. Balancing growth with affordability and sustainability will be key to ensuring that everyone in Miami can benefit from the tech boom.
For young people interested in tech, Miami is becoming a place of opportunity, where new ideas are shaping the city's future. The big question remains: will Miami keep its unique character as it grows into a global tech hub? Only time will tell, but one thing's for sure Miami's on the rise, and it's not slowing down.

title: How Tech Lobbying is Reshaping Florida's Regulatory Framework: Key Insights for Businesses
author: Angela Scott-Briggs
excerpt: Tech lobbying is taking part in a pivotal role in reshaping Florida's regulatory framework. As tech companies continue to expand their presence in the state, their influence on key issues like data…
summary:
Tech lobbying is taking part in a pivotal role in reshaping Florida's regulatory framework. As tech companies continue to expand their presence in the state, their influence on key issues like data privacy, cybersecurity, and workforce development will only grow. For businesses, understanding the impact of tech lobbying is essential for staying competitive and compliant in an increasingly digital economy. Whether you're a tech startup or a traditional business looking to leverage digital tools, staying informed about the regulatory environment in Florida is more important than ever. By keeping an eye on the shifting landscape, businesses can position themselves for success in the Sunshine State's evolving tech ecosystem.
The Rise of Tech Lobbying in Florida:
Tech lobbying, the organized effort by technology companies to influence legislation and public policy, has seen a significant increase in Florida over the past decade. While Silicon Valley remains the epicenter of tech innovation, Florida has emerged as an attractive hub for tech startups, thanks to its favorable business environment, lower taxes, and a growing tech talent pool.
This rise in tech presence has naturally led to increased lobbying activity. Tech companies are keen to influence Florida's legislative decisions, particularly in areas like data privacy, cybersecurity, and digital infrastructure. The influx of tech companies in the state is not just about bringing jobs; it's also about ensuring that the regulations governing their operations align with their business models and future growth strategies.
Key Drivers Behind Tech Lobbying Efforts:
Several factors have contributed to the surge in tech lobbying in Florida:
Data Privacy Laws:
With data privacy becoming a hot-button issue globally, Florida has become a battleground for discussions on how personal data should be managed and protected. Tech companies, especially those in social media, e-commerce, and data analytics, are keen to influence how stringent these laws become.
Infrastructure Investment:
Tech companies are pushing for more investment in digital infrastructure, particularly 5G networks and broadband expansion. Florida's diverse geography, from dense urban areas to rural communities, presents unique challenges that tech lobbying seeks to address.
Tax Incentives and Business-Friendly Policies:
Florida has long been known for its low-tax environment, but tech companies want to ensure that new regulations do not disrupt this favorable business climate. Lobbying efforts are often geared towards maintaining or enhancing tax incentives that benefit tech firms.
Workforce Development:
As the demand for tech talent grows, companies are advocating for policies that promote STEM education and workforce development programs. Ensuring a steady pipeline of skilled workers is crucial for the long-term success of Florida's tech industry.
The Impact of Tech Lobbying on Florida's Regulatory Framework:
Tech lobbying in Florida is not just about tweaking existing regulations; it is reshaping the state's entire approach to governance in the digital age. Here are some of the key ways in which tech lobbying is influencing Florida's regulatory framework:
Data Privacy Regulations:
One of the most significant areas where tech lobbying has made an impact is in data privacy regulations. Florida has been considering legislation similar to California's Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), which gives consumers more control over how their personal data is collected and used. Tech companies, particularly those heavily reliant on user data, have been actively lobbying to ensure that Florida's version of the law is business-friendly.
While consumer advocates push for stricter privacy protections, tech lobbyists argue that overly restrictive regulations could stifle innovation and harm businesses that rely on data for targeted advertising, personalization, and other digital services. The outcome of these lobbying efforts will have far-reaching implications not only for tech companies but also for businesses that operate in sectors where data is a valuable asset.
Cybersecurity and Digital Infrastructure:
As Florida continues to position itself as a tech hub, cybersecurity and digital infrastructure have become top priorities. Tech lobbyists are pushing for state investment in robust cybersecurity measures to protect both businesses and consumers from digital threats. This includes advocating for stronger cybersecurity standards, more funding for digital infrastructure, and policies that promote public-private partnerships in cybersecurity.
Additionally, tech companies are lobbying for the expansion of 5G networks and broadband internet access across the state. With remote work becoming the norm and digital services expanding, having a reliable and fast digital infrastructure is crucial for the state's economic growth. Lobbying efforts have been instrumental in shaping Florida's approach to these issues.
Tax Policies Favoring Tech Growth:
Florida's tax policies have long been a draw for businesses, particularly its lack of state income tax. However, tech companies are advocating for even more favorable tax policies that can help them grow and scale their operations. This includes tax incentives for research and development (R&D), as well as tax breaks for tech startups and venture capital investments.
The tech industry's lobbying efforts have focused on ensuring that Florida remains competitive with other states that offer similar incentives. For businesses, particularly startups, these tax policies can make a significant difference in their ability to attract investors and scale quickly.
Workforce and Talent Development:
The rapid growth of Florida's tech sector has created a strong demand for skilled workers, particularly in areas like software development, cybersecurity, and artificial intelligence (AI). Tech companies have been actively lobbying for policies that promote STEM (science, technology, engineering, and math) education and workforce development programs.
These efforts include advocating for increased funding for STEM programs in schools, expanding apprenticeship and internship opportunities, and creating pathways for tech workers to transition from other industries. For businesses, this focus on talent development is crucial, as it ensures a steady supply of skilled workers needed to stay competitive in the digital age.
Challenges and Controversies Surrounding Tech Lobbying:
While tech lobbying has undoubtedly shaped Florida's regulatory framework, it has also sparked controversy. Critics argue that tech companies have too much influence over state policy, leading to regulations that favor big business at the expense of consumer protection and fair competition. For example, some consumer advocacy groups have voiced concerns that tech lobbyists are watering down data privacy laws to make them less effective.
Additionally, small businesses and startups that lack the resources for large-scale lobbying efforts may find themselves at a disadvantage in a regulatory environment shaped by big tech companies. As tech giants push for regulations that suit their business models, smaller firms may struggle to comply with complex regulatory requirements, creating barriers to entry and stifling innovation.
What Businesses Should Know:
For businesses operating in Florida, the influence of tech lobbying on the regulatory framework presents both opportunities and challenges. On the one hand, tech-friendly regulations can create a more favorable environment for businesses that rely on digital tools and services. On the other hand, the evolving regulatory landscape can create compliance challenges, particularly in areas like data privacy and cybersecurity.
Businesses should stay informed about changes to Florida's regulatory environment, particularly those influenced by tech lobbying. Engaging with industry groups and staying active in policy discussions can help businesses navigate the regulatory landscape and ensure their interests are represented.
Conclusion:
Since recent years, technology has advanced at an unprecedented rate, and with it, the role of tech companies has evolved from being mere providers of digital services to powerful stakeholders shaping state policies. Nowhere is this more evident than in Florida, where tech lobbying efforts have begun to reshape the regulatory landscape. The Sunshine State, once known for its relaxed regulatory environment, is now at the forefront of a transformation driven by the tech industry's growing influence. For businesses operating in Florida or looking to expand into this market, understanding the implications of tech lobbying on the regulatory framework is essential. This article provides key insights into how tech lobbying is reshaping Florida's regulations and what it means for businesses.
